Package.Name: SARS-CoV-2.wwsurv.1.0
Package.Description: Use for SARS-CoV-2 wastewater surveillance samples that are relevant to public health. Required attributes include those considered useful for the rapid analysis and trace back of SARS-CoV-2 cases.
Package.TemplateHeader: # This is a submission template for batch deposit of 'SARS-CoV-2: wastewater surveillance; version 1.0' samples to the NCBI BioSample database (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/). # Fields with an asterisk (*) are mandatory. Your submission will fail if any mandatory fields are not completed. If information is unavailable for any mandatory field, please enter 'not collected', 'not applicable' or 'missing' as appropriate. # All other fields are optional. Leave optional fields empty if no information is available. # You can add any number of custom fields to fully describe your BioSamples, simply include them in the table. # CAUTION: Be aware that Excel may automatically apply formatting to your data. In particular, take care with dates, incrementing autofills and special characters like / or -. Doublecheck that your text file is accurate before uploading to BioSample. # TO MAKE A SUBMISSION: # 1. Complete the template table (typically in Excel, or another spreadsheet application) # 2. Save the worksheet as a Text (Tab-delimited) file - use 'File, Save as, Save as type: Text (Tab-delimited)' # 3. Upload the file on the 'Attributes' tab of the BioSample Submission Portal at https://submit.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/subs/biosample/. # 4. If you have any questions, please contact us at biosamplehelp@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov.

Attribute.Name: collection date
Attribute.Description: the date on which the sample was collected; date/time ranges are supported by providing two dates from among the supported value formats, delimited by a forward-slash character; collection times are supported by adding "T", then the hour and minute after the date, and must be in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), otherwise known as "Zulu Time" (Z); supported formats include "DD-Mmm-YYYY", "Mmm-YYYY", "YYYY" or ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-mm-dd", "YYYY-mm", "YYYY-mm-ddThh:mm:ss"; e.g., 30-Oct-1990, Oct-1990, 1990, 1990-10-30, 1990-10, 21-Oct-1952/15-Feb-1953, 2015-10-11T17:53:03Z; valid non-ISO dates will be automatically transformed to ISO format

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from this list http://www.insdc.org/documents/country-qualifier-vocabulary. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Canada: Vancouver" or "Germany: halfway down Zugspitze, Alps"

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.

Attribute.Name: wastewater population
Attribute.Description: Number of persons contributing wastewater to this sample collection site; if unknown, estimate to the nearest order of magnitude, e.g., 10000. If no estimate is available, input NA.

Attribute.Name: wastewater sample duration
Attribute.Description: Duration of composite sample collected, in units of hours, e.g., 24. Specify integer values. If the sample is not a composite sample, use 0.

Attribute.Name: wastewater sample matrix
Attribute.Description: The wastewater matrix that was sampled

Format.Description: raw wastewater | sewer pipeline sediments | post grit removal | primary sludge | primary effluent | secondary sludge | secondary effluent | other | missing | not applicable | not collected | not provided | restricted access

Attribute.Name: wastewater sample type
Attribute.Description: Type of wastewater sample collected

Format.Description: grab | composite | swab-grab | swab-composite | missing | not applicable | not collected | not provided | restricted access

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 1
Attribute.Description: Taxonomic name of the surveillance target. For the COVID-19 response, use 'SARS-CoV-2'.

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 1 known present
Attribute.Description: Is genetic material of the surveillance target(s) known to the submitter to be present in this wastewater sample? Presence defined as microbiological evidence of the target organism in the wastewater sample, such as genetic- or culture-based detection.

Attribute.Name: collected by
Attribute.Description: Name of persons or institute who collected the sample

Attribute.Name: purpose of wastewater sampling
Attribute.Description: The reason the sample was collected

Format.Description: public health surveillance community-level | public health surveillance institution-level | public health surveillance building-level | research | other | missing | not applicable | not collected | not provided | restricted access

Attribute.Name: purpose of wastewater sequencing
Attribute.Description: The reason the sample was sequenced, e.g., identification of mutations within a specific region, presence of clinically known mutations, or diversity of mutations across entire genome

Attribute.Name: sequenced by
Attribute.Description: The name of the agency that generated the sequence, e.g., Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

Attribute.Name: wastewater endogenous control 1
Attribute.Description: The name of an organism, gene, or compound used as an endogenous wastewater control, e.g., pepper mild mottle virus

Attribute.Name: wastewater endogenous control 1 concentration
Attribute.Description: The concentration of the endogenous control specified in 'ww_endog_control_1' on a per wastewater unit basis, e.g., 700000000

Attribute.Name: wastewater endogenous control 1 protocol
Attribute.Description: The protocol used to quantify 'ww_endog_control_1'. Specify a reference, website, or brief description.

Attribute.Name: wastewater endogenous control 1 units
Attribute.Description: The units of the value specified in 'ww_endog_control_1_conc', e.g., copies/L wastewater

Attribute.Name: wastewater endogenous control 2
Attribute.Description: The name of an organism, gene, or compound used as an endogenous wastewater control, e.g., crassphage

Attribute.Name: wastewater endogenous control 2 concentration
Attribute.Description: The concentration of the endogenous control specified in 'ww_endog_control_2' on a per wastewater unit basis, e.g., 140000000

Attribute.Name: wastewater endogenous control 2 protocol
Attribute.Description: The protocol used to quantify 'ww_endog_control_2'. Specify a reference, website, or brief description.

Attribute.Name: wastewater endogenous control 2 units
Attribute.Description: The units of the value specified in 'ww_endog_control_2_conc', e.g., copies/L wastewater

Attribute.Name: wastewater flow
Attribute.Description: Daily volumetric flow through collection site, in units of liters per day, e.g., 110000000.

Attribute.Name: wastewater industrial effluent percent
Attribute.Description: Percentage of industrial effluents received by wastewater treatment plant, e.g., 10

Attribute.Name: wastewater pH
Attribute.Description: pH measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid, e.g., 7.2

Attribute.Name: wastewater population source
Attribute.Description: Source of value specified in 'ww_population', e.g., wastewater utility billing records, population of jurisdiction encompassing the wastewater service area, census blocks clipped to wastewater service area polygon

Attribute.Name: wastewater pre-treatment
Attribute.Description: Describe any process of pre-treatment that removes materials that can be easily collected from the raw wastewater, e.g., flow equilibration basin promotes settling of some solids

Attribute.Name: wastewater primary sludge retention time
Attribute.Description: The time primary sludge remains in tank, in hours, e.g., 4.

Attribute.Name: wastewater processing protocol
Attribute.Description: The protocol used to process the wastewater sample. Processing includes laboratory procedures prior to and including nucleic acid purification (e.g., pasteurization, concentration, extraction, etc). Specify a reference, website, or brief description.

Attribute.Name: wastewater sample salinity
Attribute.Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid (in the form of an extract obtained by centrifugation) sample or derived from the conductivity measurement (practical salinity) in milligrams per liter, e.g., 100.

Attribute.Name: wastewater sample site
Attribute.Description: The type of site where the wastewater sample was collected

Format.Description: correctional facility | long-term care facility | hospital | child day care | school | college or university | social services shelter | other residential building | ship | airplane | airport | septic tank | other holding tank | wastewater treatment plant | wastewater lagoon | sewer pipeline | food or meat processing plant | other | missing | not applicable | not collected | not provided | restricted access

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance jurisdiction
Attribute.Description: A jurisdiction identifer that can be used to support linking the sample to a public health surveillance system, e.g., va

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance system sample ID
Attribute.Description: The sample ID used for submission to a public health surveillance system (e.g., CDC's National Wastewater Surveillance System), e.g., s123456

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 1 concentration
Attribute.Description: The concentration of the wastewater surveillance target specified in 'ww_surv_target_1' on a per wastewater unit basis, e.g., 200000

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 1 conc unit
Attribute.Description: The units of the value specified in 'ww_surv_target_1_conc', e.g., copies/L wastewater

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 1 extract
Attribute.Description: Measured amount of surveillance target in the nucleic acid extract that was sequenced; on a per extract unit basis, rather than on a per wastewater sample unit basis, e.g., 100000

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 1 extract unit
Attribute.Description: The units of the value specified in 'ww_surv_target_1_extract', e.g., copies/microliter extract

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 1 gene
Attribute.Description: The name of the gene quantified for the the surveillance target specified in 'ww_surv_target_1', e.g., N gene

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 1 protocol
Attribute.Description: The protocol used to quantify 'ww_surv_target_1'. Specify a reference, website, or brief description.

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 2
Attribute.Description: Taxonomic name of the surveillance target, eg, Norovirus

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 2 conc
Attribute.Description: The concentration of the wastewater surveillance target specified in 'ww_surv_target_2' on a per wastewater unit basis, e.g., 24000

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 2 conc unit
Attribute.Description: The units of the value specified in 'ww_surv_target_2_conc', e.g., copies/L wastewater

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 2 extract
Attribute.Description: Measured amount of surveillance target in the nucleic acid extract that was sequenced; on a per extract unit basis, rather than on a per wastewater sample unit basis, e.g., 12000

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 2 extract unit
Attribute.Description: The units of the value specified in 'ww_surv_target_2_extract', e.g., copies/microliter extract

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 2 gene
Attribute.Description: The name of the gene quantified for the the surveillance target specified in 'ww_surv_target_2', e.g., ORF1-ORF2 junction

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 2 known present
Attribute.Description: Is genetic material of the surveillance target(s) known to the submitter to be present in this wastewater sample? Presence defined as microbiological evidence of the target organism in the wastewater sample, such as genetic- or culture-based detection.

Attribute.Name: wastewater surveillance target 2 protocol
Attribute.Description: The protocol used to quantify 'ww_surv_target_2'. Specify a reference, website, or brief description.

Attribute.Name: wastewater temperature
Attribute.Description: Temperature of the wastewater sample at the time of sampling in Celsius, e.g., 25.

Attribute.Name: wastewater total suspended solids
Attribute.Description: Total concentration of solids in raw wastewater influent sample including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter in milligrams per liter, e.g., 500.
